workflow.name: Pdf RAG agent with Telegram chat & auto-ingestion from Google Drive
workflow.description:
## How it works

This workflow creates an intelligent document assistant called "Mookie" that can answer questions based on your uploaded documents. Here's how it operates:

- **Document Ingestion:** The system can automatically load PDF files from Google Drive or accept PDFs uploaded directly through Telegram, then processes and stores them in a PostgreSQL vector database using Mistral embeddings
- **Smart Retrieval:** When users ask questions via Telegram or a web chat interface, the AI agent searches through the stored documents to find relevant information using vector similarity matching
- **Contextual Responses:** Using GPT-4 and the retrieved document context, Mookie provides accurate answers based solely on the ingested documents, avoiding hallucination by refusing to answer questions not covered in the stored materials
- **Memory & Conversation:** The system maintains conversation history for each user, allowing for natural follow-up questions and contextual discussions

## Set up steps

**Estimated setup time:** 30-45 minutes
You'll need to configure several external services and credentials:

- Set up a PostgreSQL database with PGVector extension for document storage
- Create accounts and API keys for Azure OpenAI (GPT-4), Mistral Cloud (embeddings), and Google Drive access
	- Connect your own LLM's if you don't have these credentials.
- Configure a Telegram bot and obtain API credentials for chat functionality
- Update webhook URLs throughout the workflow to match your n8n instance
- Test the document ingestion pipeline with sample PDFs
- Verify the chat interfaces (both Telegram and web) are responding correctly

>The workflow includes approval mechanisms for PDF ingestion and handles both automated bulk processing from Google Drive and real-time document uploads through Telegram. Read the sticky notes provided in the template code for clear instructions.

options.systemMessage:
* You are a helpful assistant(A workflow in n8n) called Mookie.

* Always retrieve your information from the vector store tool, called ''Postgres PGVector Store2''.

* Do not answer irrelevant questions which their answer is not found in the vector store.

* You must not hallucinate or generate false information. Use the vector store as your only source of information.

parameters.content:
# Credentials
This workflow requires 5 different credential configurations to connect with external services. Set up each credential in n8n's credential manager before activating the workflow.
1. Azure OpenAI API
Used for: GPT-4 language model powering the AI agents
Required fields:

Resource name (your Azure OpenAI resource)
API key from Azure portal
API version (use latest available)
Deployment name for GPT-4 model

Setup guide: https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/credentials/azureopenai/
2. Mistral Cloud API
Used for: Text embeddings to convert documents into searchable vectors
Required fields:

API key from Mistral AI platform
Model selection (use default embedding model)

Setup guide: https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/credentials/mistralcloud/
3. PostgreSQL Database
Used for: Vector storage with PGVector extension for document retrieval
Required fields:

Host, port, database name
Username and password
SSL settings (recommended: require)
Prerequisites: Install PGVector extension in your PostgreSQL database

Setup guide: https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/credentials/postgres/
4. Google Drive OAuth2 API
Used for: Automatic PDF ingestion from designated Google Drive folder
Required fields:

Client ID and Client Secret from Google Cloud Console
OAuth2 authorization flow completion
Prerequisites: Enable Google Drive API in Google Cloud Console

Setup guide: https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/credentials/google/
5. Telegram Bot API
Used for: Chat interface and file uploads via Telegram
Required fields:

Bot token from @BotFather
Bot username
Prerequisites: Create bot via @BotFather on Telegram

Setup guide: https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/credentials/telegram/
Important: Test each credential after setup to ensure proper connectivity before running the workflow.

# Start Using This Workflow

## Quick Setup (5 minutes)

### 1. Update Your URLs
- Open **Send PDF File** and **Send Downloaded PDF File** nodes
- Replace `https://your_n8n_instance_url/webhook/ingest-pdf` with your actual n8n webhook URL
- Copy the URL from your **PDF Ingest Webhook** node

### 2. Configure Google Drive
- In **List All File Names** node, change "myfiles" to your folder name
- Create a folder in Google Drive and add some PDFs for testing

### 3. Database Setup
- Ensure your PostgreSQL has PGVector extension installed
- The workflow creates tables automatically

## Testing Your Setup

### Step 1: Test Document Ingestion
1. **Manual test:** Click **Run Ingestion** to process Google Drive PDFs
2. **Telegram test:** Send a PDF to your bot, approve when asked
3. Both should show "Ingestion Completed Successfully"

### Step 2: Test Chat Features
1. **Ask questions** about your uploaded documents
2. Try both Telegram chat and the canvas chat interface
3. The bot should answer based on your documents and refuse irrelevant questions

## Key Settings to Adjust

- **Chunk Size (800):** Make smaller for precise answers, larger for more context
- **TopK (5):** Increase if bot says "no relevant documents found"
- **Temperature (0.1):** Keep low for factual responses
- **System Message:** Customize how your assistant behaves

## Common Issues & Fixes

**Bot not responding?** Check your Telegram bot token and webhook URLs

**Poor document retrieval?** Increase TopK value from 5 to 10

**Ingestion failing?** Verify Google Drive folder permissions and PDF file formats

**Out of context errors?** Your documents might be too large - try smaller PDFs first

## Pro Tips

- Start with 2-3 small, well-formatted PDFs
- Ask specific questions rather than broad topics
- Use the Google Drive auto-ingestion for bulk processing
- Use Telegram for real-time document uploads and chat

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
